subject: p19499595
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. No definite focal consolidation is seen. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. The patient is status post median sternotomy with multiple fractured sternal wires including the third superior most and additional more inferior as also seen previously. Cardiac silhouette is mildly enlarged. There may be slight prominence of the main pulmonary artery, which may be in part related to patient positioning, however, underlying pulmonary hypertension is not excluded.
